content.description: Climb awesome, green, lichened slab past crux between bolts 3 and 4. After ascending easier ground for 15 feet, head slightly right, pull a easy roof with large holds, and find more 5.9 moves on upper headwall. Good times!
content.location: It is the first route on the east side of the RV Wall.

content.description: Climb vertical sidepulls and crimps. The crux is at the last bolt before the anchor.
content.location: This is the first route you come to when doing The Grotto approach. It's the furthest west route on the entire RV Wall.

content.description: Climb slab past a couple bouldery moves.
content.location: This is the 3rd route to the climber's left. It is located in a small alcove.

content.description: Climb pink rock and a green, lichened face. Stay on the arete' for a more exposed challenge (maybe 5.8) or use lower angled slope to the left. It is a great warm-up! Look out of stinging nettles at the base :-)
content.location:
The route is easy to spot from the main area below

Winnebago Warrior

and

Euro Vision

. It faces east and has a beautiful mosaic of lime green lichen and pink quartzite.

content.description: Climb a clean slab with a fun, easy, bouldery start to a steeper face. The crux is at bolt #3, and a second crux exists near the top. This is super fun with good feet, good hand holds, and a rest or two.
content.location:
This climb is right in the center of steeper wall, about 30 feet climbers' right or west of

Euro Van

. Look for an obvious slab start with tight bolting right above to protect ledgefall potential.

content.description: Climb steep edges, and pass the crux between bolts 2 and 3; the top eases off to sustained 5.10.
content.location: It is the fourth route to the climber's left.

content.description:
This variation to

San Juan Skyway

uses face and finger crack to the climber's right. Begin lower( 20') and around the corner by climbing dubious start to a pedestal before entering the all too brief steep crack; finding a few locker jams and foot pods... this seems like mid-grade 5.10...?
content.protection:
9 QDs to the top of

San Juan Skyway

.
content.location:
Begin just 10 feet climber's left and 20 vertical feet lower than

San Juan Skyway

.

content.description: Climb steep edges with the occasional resting hold.
content.location: The route is located in The Grotto, it is the second route to the climber's left.

content.description:
Follow faint arete just right of "

5th Wheel

" using bigger holds on that arete and thinner face holds to the right. The crux is at the 3rd bolt.
content.location:
This climb starts just right of "

5th Wheel

". The anchors of both routes are at the same height, but Happy Camper required only three bolts to protect.

content.description:
Follow a slab up and right of

Winnebago Warrior

, and enter awesome upper headwall through pink/black rock. The upper cruxes are well-protected with a 10 foot sequence of .10+/.11. Look for a clutch kneebar, no hander rest, and a few key holds that make this thing climbable. The crux reach to a gaston near the last bolt is quite height-dependent, requiring a cool foot stab if you're 5'9" of shorter (maybe .11b).

Start with the first bolt and slab moves of "

North Shore

". When on top of the slab, look right for three tightly spaced bolts to protect a ledge fall. The crux is between bolts 1-3 (5.10-). Then pull a short roof, and follow line of bolts. It eases off throughout the middle and another crux is right before the anchor (5.9/10-).
content.location:
It is just climbers' right of "

North Shore

" on the main wall.

content.description:
Start at the base of "

Euro Van

," and follow a blocky ramp (5.4) to an obvious flake and hanging corner system (5.8). It has fun moves with solid gear. It passes the anchor of "Brave Little Pop-Up" and ends at the anchor for "

North Shore

". This was the first climb to ascend the main wall, and the bolted routes came later.

climbs.name: County Line
climbs.fa: I. Altman, K. Allinger and E. Poss, 2015

content.description: Climb up a corner, then step left, and follow a meandering line of bolts. The cruxes exist at bolt 2, 6, and 9. The upper crux is the hardest(5.10+). It is tightly bolted to avoid ledgefalls.
content.location:
It is located just around the corner and to the west of

San Juan Skyway

.

climbs.name: Brave Little Pop-up
climbs.fa: David Kozak, Ryan Curry, and Crystal Presnel

content.description: This is another fun route at RV Wall.
content.protection: Bolts and a bolted anchor with chains.
content.location:
This route starts about ten feet left of

North Shore

.

content.description: Climb onto large hanging flake (way more solid than it appears), and pass another small roof with vertical rock above.
content.location: This route is located in The Grotto. Look for a plaque beneath it.

content.description: Climb a short, overhanging wall passing 4 bolts. This is more pumpy than technical.
content.location: It is on the climber's far left side of the cliff.
